thread.title: Stoke by-election: Labour hopeful Gareth Snell SQUIRMS as he defends 'BREXIT IS S***' rant
thread.title_full: Stoke by-election: Labour hopeful Gareth Snell SQUIRMS as he defends 'BREXIT IS S***' rant

title: Stoke by-election: Labour hopeful Gareth Snell SQUIRMS as he defends 'BREXIT IS S***' rant
text:
Stoke by-election: Labour hopeful Gareth Snell SQUIRMS as he defends 'BREXIT IS S***' rant Stoke by-election: Labour hopeful Gareth Snell SQUIRMS as he defends 'BREXIT IS S***' rant LABOUR'S candidate in the Stoke Central by-election has defended branding Brexit "s***" in a Twitter rant. PUBLISHED: 21:59, Sun, Feb 19, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:13, Sun, Feb 19, 2017 
Would-be MP Gareth Snell posted a poem reading "Soft Brexit , hard Brexit/Massive pile of s***" in September. 
And he squirmed as he tried to justify the four-letter rant during an interview with BBC show Sunday Politics. 
Around 70 per cent of people in Stoke-on-Trent, where he is standing against Ukip chief Paul Nuttall, voted to leave the EU. Related articles Labour Stoke by-election candidate slates local hero ROBBIE WILLIAMS 
Mr Snell said: "I tweeted many things about Brexit â€“ that tweet's out there, it was done quite after the referendum result. 
"It was my way of showing my frustration at the fact that, months after the result, we hadn't had anything from the Government. 
" Theresa May had failed to produce any plan, she had failed to give any meaningful statement about what Brexit meant." BBC Labour's Gareth Snell branded Brexit a 'massive pile of s***' BREXIT: Which parts of the UK had the majority vote? Fri, February 17, 2017 Much of the North East of the United Kingdom voted to leave the European Union including Sunderland, Gateshead, Darlington, Durham, Hartlepool, Middlesbrough, Stockton, Redcar and Cleveland, North Tyneside and South Tyneside, and Northumberland. Newcastle was the only borough to vote to remain, though by a narrow margin, which was likely due to its large student population and dependency on EU funding.
